channel.title: Need Help with Clanwars
channel.description:
Allright, So I'm working on making my clanwars a safe zone (players die, and are just teleported back to the recruitment room, rather than being teleported home and losing all of their items)
My problem : I'm pretty sure I've got it down to if "inclanwar = true", then it should teleport them upon death without them losing items.
However, I've made it so that when a player enters the clanwar portal, "inclanwar" becomes true, and they are set to a team. (If this is wrong, please correct me)
The Compiling problem...
client.java:1733: not a statement clan == 1; ^ client.java:1743: not a statement inclanwar == true; ^ client.java:1755: not a statement clan == 2; ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .
Any help is appreciated, Thanks very much, Zithro.

item.title: Need Help with Clanwars
item.dc:creator: @Nezzlon Nezzlon
item.description:
@Nezzlon wrote:

these are not supported in javascript thats why they say not a statement.
What you need is to delete them and then add a new boolean applydead1() or something and take away the youdied() statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help with Clanwars
item.dc:creator: @zithro zithro
item.description:
@zithro wrote:

Allright, So I’m working on making my clanwars a safe zone (players die, and are just teleported back to the recruitment room, rather than being teleported home and losing all of their items)

My problem : I’m pretty sure I’ve got it down to if “inclanwar = true”, then it should teleport them upon death without them losing items.

However, I’ve made it so that when a player enters the clanwar portal, “inclanwar” becomes true, and they are set to a team. (If this is wrong, please correct me)

The Compiling problem…

client.java:1733: not a statement
clan == 1;
^
client.java:1743: not a statement
inclanwar == true;
^
client.java:1755: not a statement
clan == 2;
^
3 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Any help is appreciated, Thanks very much, Zithro.

Read full topic
